title: Authors and Citation
text: Wei Hong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hong W (2025). OncReg: Cancer Registry Tools. R package version 0.7.0, https://github.com/hongconsulting/OncReg.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OncReg: Cancer Registry Tools},   author = {Wei Hong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.7.0},   url = {https://github.com/hongconsulting/OncReg}, }

title: Cancer Registry Tools
text: Tools working cancer registry data.

title: Cancer Registry Tools
text: can install development version OncReg GitHub :

title: Cancer Registry Tools
code: library(OncReg) options(width = 120) diagnosis <- c("01/01/00", "01/01/2000", "36526", "36526", "36526") treatment <- c("capecitabine",                 "LETROZOLE",                 "letrozole, palbociclib",                 "Letrozole,Ribociclib",                 "anastrozole, ribociclib") progression <- c("01/01/2001", ".", "01/01/2001", "", NA) review1 <- c("01/07/2001", "01/07/2001", "01/07/2001", "01/07/2001", "01/07/2001") review2 <- c(NA, NA, NA, NA, "01/01/2002") death <- c("01/01/2002", "01/01/2002", NA, NA, NA) data0 <- data.frame("id" = 1:5, "diagnosis" = diagnosis, "treatment" = treatment, "progression" = progression, "review1" = review1, "review2" = review2, "death" = death) print(data0) #>   id  diagnosis               treatment progression    review1    review2      death #> 1  1   01/01/00            capecitabine  01/01/2001 01/07/2001       <NA> 01/01/2002 #> 2  2 01/01/2000               LETROZOLE           . 01/07/2001       <NA> 01/01/2002 #> 3  3      36526  letrozole, palbociclib  01/01/2001 01/07/2001       <NA>       <NA> #> 4  4      36526    Letrozole,Ribociclib             01/07/2001       <NA>       <NA> #> 5  5      36526 anastrozole, ribociclib        <NA> 01/07/2001 01/01/2002       <NA>  # delimited strings data1 <- data.frame("id" = data0$id, "treatment" = data0$treatment) data1$treatment <- OR.delim.replace(data1$treatment, "anastrozole", "ai") data1$treatment <- OR.delim.replace(data1$treatment, "letrozole", "ai") data1$treatment <- OR.delim.replace(data1$treatment, "palbociclib", "cdk46i") data1$treatment <- OR.delim.replace(data1$treatment, "ribociclib", "cdk46i")  # Microsoft Excel dates data1$diagnosis <- OR.dmyY.to.Excel(data0$diagnosis, 20, 25) data1$progression <- OR.dmyY.to.Excel(data0$progression, 20, 25) data1$review1 <- OR.dmyY.to.Excel(data0$review1, 20, 25) data1$review2 <- OR.dmyY.to.Excel(data0$review2, 20, 25) data1$death <- OR.dmyY.to.Excel(data0$death, 20, 25)  # progression-free survival and overall survival data1$PFS <- OR.rowmin(cbind(data1$progression, data1$death)) data1$lastreview <- OR.rowmax(cbind(data1$review1, data1$review2)) data1$PFSmonths <- OR.survoutcome(data1$diagnosis, data1$PFS, data1$lastreview)[, 1] data1$PFSstatus <- OR.survoutcome(data1$diagnosis, data1$PFS, data1$lastreview)[, 2] data1$OSmonths <- OR.survoutcome(data1$diagnosis, data1$death, data1$lastreview)[, 1] data1$OSstatus <- OR.survoutcome(data1$diagnosis, data1$death, data1$lastreview)[, 2]  print(data1) #>   id    treatment diagnosis progression review1 review2 death   PFS lastreview PFSmonths PFSstatus OSmonths OSstatus #> 1  1 capecitabine     36526       36892   37073      NA 37257 36892      37073  12.02489         1 24.01692        1 #> 2  2           ai     36526          NA   37073      NA 37257 37257      37073  24.01692         1 24.01692        1 #> 3  3   ai, cdk46i     36526       36892   37073      NA    NA 36892      37073  12.02489         1 17.97162        0 #> 4  4   ai, cdk46i     36526          NA   37073      NA    NA    NA      37073  17.97162         0 17.97162        0 #> 5  5   ai, cdk46i     36526          NA   37073   37257    NA    NA      37257  24.01692         0 24.01692        0

Convert missing values to zero — OR.NA.to.0
text: x Numeric vector matrix.

title: Convert missing values to zero — OR.NA.to.0

Convert missing values to FALSE — OR.NA.to.F

what: Detect delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.contains
title: Detect delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.contains
text: delimiter, trims whitespace, converts lowercase, checks whether delimited element matches one specified strings.

title: Detect delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.contains
Detect delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.contains
text: x String vector, matrix, data frame containing delimited strings. match String vector elements match (case- whitespace-insensitive). delimiter String delimiter. Default = ",".

title: Detect delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.contains
text: logical vector matrix indicating whether string contains delimited element matching specified strings.

what: Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
title: Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
text: Splits string vector, matrix, data frame specified delimiter, trims whitespace, converts lowercase, checks whether delimited element matches one specified strings. Replaces matching elements new string, removes duplicate elements, sorts elements alphabetically, rejoins elements using delimiter.

title: Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
text: x String vector, matrix, data frame containing delimited strings. match String vector elements match (case- whitespace-insensitive). replacement String delimited element replacement (case- whitespace-insensitive). delimiter String delimiter. Default = ",".

title: Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
text: string vector matrix replaced delimited elements.

title: Replace delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.replace
code: treatment <- c("capecitabine",                "LETROZOLE",                "letrozole, palbociclib",                "Letrozole,Ribociclib",                "anastrozole, ribociclib") treatment <- OR.delim.replace(treatment, "anastrozole", "ai") treatment <- OR.delim.replace(treatment, "letrozole", "ai") treatment <- OR.delim.replace(treatment, "palbociclib", "cdk46i") treatment <- OR.delim.replace(treatment, "ribociclib", "cdk46i") print(treatment) #> [1] "capecitabine" "ai"           "ai, cdk46i"   "ai, cdk46i"   "ai, cdk46i"

what: Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
title: Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
text: Splits string string vector, matrix, data frame specified delimiter, trims whitespace, converts lowercase, tabulates frequency unique delimited elements.

title: Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
text: x String vector, matrix, data frame containing delimited strings. delimiter String delimiter. Default = ",".

title: Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
text: table delimited element frequencies (case- whitespace-insensitive).

title: Frequency table of delimited string elements (case- and whitespace-insensitive) — OR.delim.table
code: treatment <- c("capecitabine",                "LETROZOLE",                "letrozole, palbociclib",                "Letrozole,Ribociclib",                "anastrozole, ribociclib") print(OR.delim.table(treatment)) #>  #>  anastrozole capecitabine    letrozole  palbociclib   ribociclib  #>            1            1            3            1            2

what: #' Detect if all substrings are contained in each string vector element #' (case-insensitive) #' #' Checks whether each element of a string vector contains all of the specified #' substrings using case-insensitive matching. #' @param x String vector. #' @param match String vector of substrings to look for within each element of #' x. #' @return Logical vector indicating whether each element contains a match. #' @export OR.contains.AND <- function(x, match) f <- function(x) g <- function(match) return(grepl(tolower(match), tolower(x), fixed = TRUE)) return(all(sapply(match, g))) return(unname(sapply(x, f))) — OR.dmy.to.dmY
title: #' Detect if all substrings are contained in each string vector element #' (case-insensitive) #' #' Checks whether each element of a string vector contains all of the specified #' substrings using case-insensitive matching. #' @param x String vector. #' @param match String vector of substrings to look for within each element of #' x. #' @return Logical vector indicating whether each element contains a match. #' @export OR.contains.AND <- function(x, match) f <- function(x) g <- function(match) return(grepl(tolower(match), tolower(x), fixed = TRUE)) return(all(sapply(match, g))) return(unname(sapply(x, f))) — OR.dmy.to.dmY
text: #' Detect substrings contained string vector element #' (case-insensitive) #' #' Checks whether element string vector contains specified #' substrings using case-insensitive matching. #' @param x String vector. #' @param match String vector substrings look within element #' x. #' @return Logical vector indicating whether element contains match. #' @export .contains.<- function(x, match) f <- function(x) g <- function(match) return(grepl(tolower(match), tolower(x), fixed = TRUE))return((sapply(match, g)))return(unname(sapply(x, f)))

title: #' Detect if all substrings are contained in each string vector element #' (case-insensitive) #' #' Checks whether each element of a string vector contains all of the specified #' substrings using case-insensitive matching. #' @param x String vector. #' @param match String vector of substrings to look for within each element of #' x. #' @return Logical vector indicating whether each element contains a match. #' @export OR.contains.AND <- function(x, match) f <- function(x) g <- function(match) return(grepl(tolower(match), tolower(x), fixed = TRUE)) return(all(sapply(match, g))) return(unname(sapply(x, f))) — OR.dmy.to.dmY

what: Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel
title: Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel
text: Converts string dates may serial (using Microsoft Excel offset), "d/m/y" (e.g., "01/01/00"), "d/m/Y" format (e.g., "01/01/2000") numeric serial dates. Two-digit years expanded using specified century pivot year.

title: Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel
Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel
text: input String vector dates serial, "d/m/y" "d/m/Y" format. century Numeric century (e.g., 20) used expanding two-digit years. pivot Numeric threshold two-digit years > pivot expanded century - 1.

title: Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel
text: Numeric vector serial dates using Microsoft Excel offset.

title: Convert mixed format dates to Microsoft Excel serial dates — OR.dmyY.to.Excel

what: Identify line of restarted treatment — OR.line.restart
title: Identify line of restarted treatment — OR.line.restart
text: patient, identifies first line treatment whose start date occurs least specified number days earlier stop date.

title: Identify line of restarted treatment — OR.line.restart
Identify line of restarted treatment — OR.line.restart
text: start.dates Numeric matrix treatment start dates, one row per patient one column per line treatment. stop.dates Numeric matrix treatment stop dates, one row per patient one column per line treatment. min.days Minimum number days stop date start date required define treatment restart. Default = 182.62125.

title: Identify line of restarted treatment — OR.line.restart
text: numeric matrix two columns: first column indicating line restarted treatment second column indicating number days since previous stop date.

what: Convert string variable to binary variable — OR.string.to.binary
title: Convert string variable to binary variable — OR.string.to.binary
text: Converts string vector numeric vector according following: Elements exactly matching value missing return NA. Otherwise, elements matching fixed pattern pattern return 1. elements return 0.

title: Convert string variable to binary variable — OR.string.to.binary
Convert string variable to binary variable — OR.string.to.binary
text: input String vector evaluate. pattern String vector fixed patterns within input. missing String vector exact values treat NA.

Survival outcomes — OR.survoutcome
text: Computes event times statuses start, event, review dates.

title: Survival outcomes — OR.survoutcome
text: date_start Vector start dates. date_event Vector event dates. date_follow Vector last follow-dates censored cases. divisor Unit conversion factor time. Default = 365.2425/12.

title: Survival outcomes — OR.survoutcome
text: numeric matrix two columns: survival time status (1 = event, 0 = censored). Cases missing start dates survival time ≤ 0 returned NA columns.
